Articles.Content:
153 hours in game, but new forum member. Came here to read up on some better designs and found out you all do some pretty cool stuff with challenges and all that. Admittedly I like the design and exploration aspects more than actual piloting so I rely on mechjeb fairly heavily (I get the mechanics required but suck at doing things manually). My biggest regret is that I have not moved on from minmus and the mun yet.

Looking forward to posting and hopefully contributing to this community, preferably without killing too many more kerbals.

Duna requires very little extra dV compared to Mun/Minmus so you're existing designs for there will need very little modification when you feel like venturing out. The most important thing about interplanetary though is getting a good transfer window ([url]http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/[/url]), you can't just go whenever you like. The actual process of matching planes and doing a Hohmann transfer are more or less the same.

That said, apart from the achievement of it - and particular challenges if you're into them - I think a lot of us spend most of our time in Kerbin SOI as you can do all the cool 'space' stuff there without having to do huge timewarps all the time (KAC mod is your friend when you have several missions on the go at the same time).

ETA: Oh yeah, and I use MJ all the time. Doing the same launches and manoeuvres can get tedious after a while but it's worth learning how to do them yourself too. You know, just in case of equipment malfunctions.

Hello baronderpington, and welcome to the forum!

Like Pecan said you don't need too much more to get to Duna than you do to get to the Mun. It's mostly just a matter of leaving Kerbin at the right time. I use [URL="http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/"]this web page tool[/URL] for that.

I look forward to your contribution to the community.

Happy landings!
